content: this is my own version of the very well known mitered squares when i decided to make a mitered squares blanket to use up my leftovers of yarn i made a research and find out dozens of patterns many of them were excellent but no one was perfect for my taste so i ended up writing my own of course many of its features can be found in other patterns too but not combined as far as i know at least i hope you ll like it needles you can use circulars double-pointed or straight needles as you prefer anyway since the blanket is knitted in one piece it becomes less and less comfortable to knit with straight needles as the piece grows my personal favourites are 60 cm 24 in circulars size depends from the yarn you re using yarn any yarn will do as this patterns is basically a stashbuster you ll only need a few grams of yarn for every square construction the blanket is built in one piece after knitting the first square you ll need to pick up some stitches along its selvedge and it will become the cast on for the next one
